title: Tax Resolution Attorney John P. Willis Reports That IRS Gets a Slap on The Wrist for Bad Behavior
text:
Tax resolution attorney John Willis, CEO and founder of IRSALLSTAR.com lets taxpayers know that the IRS Civil Assets Seizure program is being audited and changing its policies after being pressured by Congress to apologize for seizing assets of law-abiding business owners.
Fairhope, AL, July 17, 2015 : Tax Attorney John Willis, CEO and founder of IRSALLSTAR.com, recently published a new article on his website entitled “After Years of Criminal Behavior, the IRS Finally Gets a Slap on the Wrist.” Taxpayers can only hope that a slap on the wrist will be affective with the IRS.
Willis doesn’t seem so sure as he writes, “The IRS has literally stolen millions of dollars from unsuspecting business owners and individuals who were unaware they were targeted simply for making bank deposits. The IRS gets a minor slap on the wrist, and all the American taxpayers get is what appears to be an insincere “I’m sorry” from the IRS.”
Willis explains the gist of the IRS program, “The IRS routinely freezes and seizes bank accounts of people who habitually make a series of deposits in short time frames that add up to $10,000 or more. The Bank Secrecy Act obligates all financial institutions to flag accounts where this type of behavior occurs.” According to Willis, “Whether the account holder has ever been involved in tax evasion, drug smuggling and terrorist activities or not the accounts are flagged. Then, the IRS can freeze the accounts and seize the assets without ever charging the account holder with a crime.” “Small business owners” states Willis “have been ruined as a result of this Civil Assets Seizure Program (aka Bank Secrecy Act). So who’s the real criminal?”
The entire article can be read at: http://www.irsallstar.com/articles/after-years-of-criminal-behavior-the-irs-finally-gets-a-slap-on-the-wrist.php
